Chapter 1 - Intro to Drakkenheim.name: 第一章：德拉肯海姆简介

Chapter 1- Introduction to Drakkenheim.name: 第一章：德拉肯海姆简介
Chapter 1- Introduction to Drakkenheim.text:
第一章：德拉肯海姆简介

德拉肯海姆已不复存在。在那个凄惨的夜晚，一场由陨落星辰组成的骇人风暴摧毁了这座城市，只留下一颗将产生深远影响的陨星。十五年后，德拉肯海姆徒余一片满是断壁残垣的废土，其中满是异界魔法的污染，而可怖的怪物出没其间。梦幻的财富、失落的知识及强大的神器静候着被足够勇敢或愚蠢到深入废墟的冒险者们寻得。然而，即使是从德拉肯海姆的危险中幸存下来的冒险者，也难以在面对其中的恐怖之物之后仍然毫发无伤。

战役概览

《德拉肯海姆之墟》是一本哥特式文艺复兴城市废墟为背景下的冒险。该战役为 4 名玩家角色设计，因此针对人数更少或更多的队伍应进行相应调整。你可以将德拉肯海姆作为一系列松散但彼此联系的探索任务运作，也可以将其运作为充满派系冲突、走向难以预料的故事。本书中的材料适合 1-13 级的玩家角色进行挑战。

  • 探索。 角色们将开展危险的探索，深入充满怪物的废墟、闹鬼的街道、破败的花园、支离破碎的法师塔、巴洛克风格的大教堂，从中寻得财宝，并解开神秘的谜团。
  • 互动。 五个对手派系在德拉肯海姆的废墟上相互摩擦。当派系的竞争目标和角色的个人目标相冲突时，一张由秘密、诡计和破坏组成的错综复杂的网络就在眼前张开。
  • 对抗。 除了各个派系派出的强悍战士之外，德拉肯海姆中还居住着各种异界的恐怖之物。角色们将与不死的行尸、凶残的野兽、变异的怪物以及由神秘陨星产生的可怖可憎之物发生战斗。

你需要一本五版核心规则才能正确运作本次冒险。在阅读本书时，加粗文本通常指向生物或非玩家角色资料卡，而斜体文本表示法术或魔法物品。本书附录中描述了许多新的怪物、物品和法术，如果它们不在附录中，请参见五版核心规则。

妄质

在整个德拉肯海姆之中都发现了具有强大魔法潜力的彩色晶体。这些发光的石头被称为"妄质"，它们散发着超自然的能量，能够引发疯狂并将生物变为怪物。尽管存在这些危险，但妄质十分适合制作魔法物品和给强大的新魔法提供能量。术士、邪术师、法师以及各种各样玄奥的施法者都渴望着它的超自然力量，因此妄质在奥法圈子和地下市场中都价值极高。但这种诡异的矿物的真正来源尚且未知。对手派系在这些水晶是应该被销毁、利用还是崇拜的问题上存在分歧，他们之间酝酿已久的分歧甚至可能会带来一场真正的战争。附录 D：妄质，魔法和法术一章中详细介绍了这些水晶。

破碎国度

德拉肯海姆曾是维斯特玛的国际化首都，由专横的冯·凯赛尔家族统治。城市毁灭之后，爆发了一场长达十年的血腥内战。王国破碎，而王室血脉也随之断绝。现在，更大范围内，宗教分裂和军事冲突撕裂了政治的秩序，令世界陷入了混乱的火海，而这座城市重建，国度光复的希望仅剩下一缕微光留存。

对手派系

为了实现自己的壮志，五个派系已经抵达了德拉肯海姆。尽管它们的观念和方法截然不同，但每个派系都在城市中寻找着宝贵的资源和失落的秘密。然而，废墟给它们的特工们设置了许多令人困惑的障碍。因此，所有派系都希望能吸引有才能的冒险者加入他们的事业，将这些未来的英雄卷入激烈的政治阴谋，并最终可能演变成激烈的暴力斗争。那些希望决定德拉肯海姆命运的人必须谨慎选择盟友和敌人！第三章：派系中包含了运作每个派系的完整细节，而关于他们的简介如下：

覆影明灯

他们的正式名称为"第四非正式首都光复远征军"，是一支由内战老兵和旧德拉肯海姆城市守卫残余组成的非正规军队。在冷酷的艾利亚斯·德雷克希尔总司令的领导下，他们发动了一场游击战，对抗盘踞在首都中的怪物、盗匪和拾荒者。每个人都发誓用生命来重建德拉肯海姆，并光复维斯特玛王国。一些贵族家族已经搁置了不和，支持覆影明灯的努力。这些家族相信，一旦城市光复，就会有证据表明有一位德拉肯海姆真正的王位继承人……或者有机会让一个狡猾的家族夺得王冠。

女王的弟兄们

"女王的弟兄们"是数百个土匪、亡命徒和无赖帮派组成的松散联盟，他们都效忠于神秘的盗贼女王。这些道德败坏之徒捕猎被吸引到这座城市的朝圣者、探矿者和探索者，打劫和勒索冒险家，将妄质走私给遥远土地上声名狼藉的客户，还掠夺城市中留下的美妙宝藏和财富。盗贼女王梦想着在废墟的无政府状态和混乱中建立一个有影响力的强大犯罪帝国，并随时密谋着对付其他派系。

白银骑士团

白银骑士团是一个由宣誓的圣武士和虔诚战士们组成的组织，他们发誓要与超自然的邪恶、黑暗的魔法和异界的入侵者作斗争。探险骑士们常常以小团体或队伍的形式在王国中旅行，并信仰神圣之火——这是整个大陆的主流宗教。他们认为妄质是由最为黑暗的混沌所产生的污染性疫病，并决心消灭这些腐化的水晶，杀死它们创造的每一个怪物，追捕那些使用其邪恶魔法的卑鄙法师。现在，在骑士统领希奥多·马歇尔的领导下，整个骑士团都被派往德拉肯海姆执行这项正义的任务。

天火信众

德拉肯海姆的覆灭在神圣之火信仰内部激起了严重的宗教分裂。一个被称为"天火信众"的新教派诞生了。他们坚信前圣火守护者卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯的预言。她声称妄质是一种神圣的馈赠，而非带来污染的疫病，这些神圣的石头将会在更大的黑暗面前提供救赎。主流的牧师们已经将卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯逐出教会，并将她的追随者称作具有异端信仰和亵渎行径的疯狂邪教。即便如此，大批虔诚的信徒现在还是踏上了前往德拉肯海姆的危险朝圣之旅，以期在神圣的蓝图中占据自己的一席之地。

紫晶学院

紫晶学院是一所为术士和法师们开办的魔法学校，它的学生们在偏远的城堡和僻静的大学中研习魔法。在一个由强大的大法师组成的神秘集团的领导下，学院还经营着一个富有进取心的法师公会，掌控着魔法物品的制造，并暗中经营着颇具影响力的奥法帮派，为整个大陆的贵族们提供奥法咨询服务。然而，在德拉肯海姆覆灭之后，学院也遭受了灭顶之灾，因为这座城市正是他们最大的据点——莫测之塔的所在地。大法师埃德瑞克·符文织者带领着学院的力量，试图进入塔楼并保障其中的秘密学识。与此同时，他们的调查小队也在进行关于妄质的超自然特性和未知危险的研究。法师们计划利用这些水晶的巨大能量来制造魔法物品，并为新的奥术法术提供能量。

"一个危险的敌人，总是在你看不见的地方移动。它会在最需要的时候侵入你的神志，消耗你的力量。"

- 普鲁托·杰克逊

污霭

德拉肯海姆中的危险绝不止怪物和对手派系。一股弥散着闪闪发光的彩色颗粒的翻腾薄雾笼罩着整座城市。冒险者们将它称为"污霭"。仿佛陨星坠落之后，这些尘埃就再没有真正落下。

角色们无法在污霭中获得长休收益。冒险者们在进入废墟之前应当充分休息，因为他们只有离开城市之后才能重新获得生命值和法术位。这种效应不能被任何寻常的装备防止，也不会被魔绳术、李欧蒙小屋等类似的角色能力绕过。这些效应在第五章：探索德拉肯海姆中会详述。

污染

角色们将会遭遇由德拉肯海姆中的生物、妄质或其他魔法现象带来的致命魔能污染。抵御疾病、魔法或毒素的能力对它通通无效。它无法自然治愈，也无法用低环法术轻易移除。玩家角色需要和派系合作，并找到创造性的解决方案来管理他们在冒险中遇到的这些问题。污染的全部规则和衰竭作用在附录 C：污染中说明。

黑暗之城的危险

最后，请注意。在德拉肯海姆中，角色们常常会发现远远超过自身能力所能击败的生物和其他危险。当武力不起作用时，谨慎和机智可能会取得胜利。冒险者必须寻找志同道合的盟友，并避免制造新的敌人。在出发探险之前，他们必须带着所需的所有装备，小心使用资源，并随时做好撤退的准备。

内容警告

德拉肯海姆描述了一个黑暗奇幻世界。我们建议玩家和主持人在战役开始前开诚布公，讨论他们的底线和禁忌。要进行这样的对谈，请注意，在本次冒险中，以下内容很常见：

  • 暴力、谋杀、血腥、残虐、食人和肉体恐怖。
  • 导致身体畸形和疯狂/精神错乱的退化性突变。
  • 老鼠、蜘蛛、虫子、恶魔、不死生物、幽魂和其他怪物。
  • 自然灾害，人命如草，内战纷争，流离失所，以及难民。
  • 道德模糊地带、社会/政治操纵、宗教狂热和军事民族主义。

本战役不包括露骨的性行为、性侵、种族偏见、系统性种族主义、恐同或跨性别恐惧。任何此类推论都纯属巧合。

Character Creation.name: 角色创建
Character Creation.text:
在《德拉肯海姆之墟》战役中，玩家角色们是故事的核心。他们的选择、冲突和个人目标会决定战役的命运——如果他们活下来的话！下面是对创建准备和这座黑暗之城较量的玩家角色的指南。我们建议玩家和 GM 在角色创建过程中密切合作交流，以获得最佳的效果。

角色选项和背景

任何核心规则中的种族或职业都能在德拉肯海姆找到。

  • 附录 E：德拉肯海姆的世界描述了在广阔的世界中可能存在的角色先祖血统、宗教、军事和魔法传统。
  • 附录 F：玩家背景中囊括了玩家可以用来将自己的角色与德拉肯海姆中的事件、人物和传说紧密联系在一起的新背景。

个人任务

一名角色在德拉肯海姆冒险的核心动机是他们的个人任务。这是玩家角色在战役中要实现的一个特定的个人目标，但玩家不需要向彼此透露自己的个人目标。

当一名角色完成自己的个人任务时，他们选择以下一项奖励：

属性值提升。 一项你选择的属性值及其上限值加 2。

新专长。 在 DM 允许范围内，你获得一项选择的新专长。

玩家角色可以从以下选择自己的任务，但也可以和 GM 一同设计自己的任务：

灾难幻象。 十五年来，我一直被陨星的景象所困扰。每当我睡觉时，我都会看到它落到自己头上。我的个人任务是亲眼一睹陨石坑的中心究竟是什么样子。我必须克服我在那里看到的一切，才能停止这些噩梦。

奥术秘密。 德拉肯海姆中有禁忌的学识。生活在废墟里的几位黑暗法师掌握了可怕而强大的新魔法。莫测之塔的图书馆无人看守，里面有记载着秘密魔法的法术书。我的个人任务是学习这些法术。

枯败之地。 自然秩序的枯败景象笼罩着德拉肯海姆，但这污染还可能会蔓延到城市之外。我的个人任务是研究在城市中污染最严重的的地方：王后公园花园、地下水道和陨石坑边缘所发现的超自然现象。也许我能在之后找到一种方式来扭转这些污染。

夺取王位。 尽管我的家族陷入了困境，但我们与冯·凯赛尔王室是远亲。我可能有权继承德拉肯海姆的王位。我的个人任务是搜索大教堂、贵族宅邸和城堡，寻找足够的证据证明自己的继承权。然后，为我自己取得王冠。

派系野心家。 五个派系之一的理想和目标便是我的理想和目标。无论是紫晶学院、天火信众、覆影明灯、白银骑士团还是女王的弟兄们。我的个人任务是加入派系，协助他们的任务，晋升，并在组织中荣升高级领导的地位。

家族事务。 我的一位家族成员或亲密好友已经与一个派系混在了一起。也许他（她）愚蠢地决定加入组织，又或者，因为一些冒犯或误解，他（她）被俘虏了。无论如何，我的个人任务是带他（她）回家。

寻找治疗。 我有一位朋友、家人或爱人被妄质所污染，变成了怪物。他（她）堕入了疯狂，迷失在了德拉肯海姆中的某处。我的个人任务是找到他（她），然后找到逆转他（她）身上可怕变化的方法。

丢失的传家宝。 我从前住在德拉肯海姆。我的个人任务是从我位于内城区的老房子里找回一件丢失的传家宝。也许这件物品有特殊的感情意义，只对我的家族成员有价值。又或者，它有神奇的魔法力量，我希望用这些力量来帮助实现我自己的野心。

怪物杀手。 我希望通过战胜最可怕的恶兽来留下英雄的传说。我的个人任务是杀死传说中盘踞在德拉肯海姆的三只最强大的怪物，并将它们的脑袋带回作为战利品。它们必须是传奇生物，并且挑战等级高于我击败它们时候的等级。我的盟友可以协助我，但我必须由自己打出致命一击！

负债压身。 我欠了 10000 金币的巨额债务，也许更多。我的个人任务是通过在德拉肯海姆收集妄质、掠夺或完成雇佣工作来偿还这笔钱。同时，我还必须躲避债主派来追杀我的赏金猎人。

个人朝圣。 作为虔诚的信徒，我的个人任务是拜访这座城市的几座圣地，并在埋葬在每一个圣地的殉道者圣骸前进行神圣的仪式：圣维特鲁维奥大教堂、圣赛莉娜修道院以及德拉肯城堡中的礼拜堂。通过这些虔诚之举，我将会理解我在神圣序位中的位置。

项上人头。 我来到德拉肯海姆是为了杀死一位派系领袖：大法师埃德瑞克·符文织者、骑士统领希奥多·马歇尔、艾利亚斯·德雷克希尔司令、卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯或盗贼女王。也许我是为了一个过去的错误施以报复，又或者，我可能是觊觎他（她）的地位，希望取而代之。无论如何，我的个人任务是杀死他（她）。

角色关系

战役从玩家角色第一次闯入废墟开始，但在那之前，他们是如何相遇的？考虑在两个或多个玩家之间建立个人联系，就像下面这些范例一样：

...血亲、表亲，或是童年伙伴。

...同样的出身、同样的宗教，或者师承同一位老师。

...过去的对手，现在则是不情愿的盟友。

...其中一位拯救了另一位的性命。

...在梦境或幻象中见过彼此。

四项关于德拉肯海姆世界的特质

附录 E：德拉肯海姆的世界中更加详细地讲述了这些背景细节，但德拉肯海姆的世设在四个关键的方面与第五版的默认世设有所不同：

  • 诸神疏远而沉默。他们不能显现化身，不会与崇拜者交流，也不会干涉凡俗事务。位面宇宙学神秘而不可知，但智者们仍然发展出了许多相互矛盾（且差之千里）的理论。
  • 神圣魔法并非源自于神。相反，牧师、德鲁伊和圣武士通过奉献、冥想与决心来引导神圣的力量。违反宗教教条不会导致能力丧失，但信仰危机则有可能。
  • 个人无法仅仅通过学习成为法师。法师和术士的奥术魔法都来自于血脉，可以通过练习和学习加以使用。当地法律禁止奥术施法者拥有贵族头衔。
  • 高等级 NPC 和施法者在整个世界里都异常罕见。尽管人数不多，但这些人仍然对社会产生了深远的影响。然而，德拉肯海姆吸引来了不同寻常数量的此类高人。

The Original Campaign.name: The Original Campaign
The Original Campaign.text:
本书中的冒险是基于 Dungeon Dudes 在 2018 年 10 月到 2019 年 12 月间运作的直播战役《德拉肯海姆之墟》创作的。其中，凯莉·麦克劳林饰演塞巴斯蒂安·克劳，吉尔·达奈蒂斯饰演维奥·斯耶纳，乔·奥戈尔曼饰演普鲁托·杰克逊，蒙蒂·马丁作为游戏主持人。

你可以在 Dungeon Dudes YouTube 频道 (www.youtube.com/dungeondudes) 和大部分视频网站上找到直播录像。如果你正在为冒险寻找灵感，可以观看它们，但请注意！里头到处都是剧透！我们还为玩家和主持人制作了丰富的指导视频，其中包括了桌面角色扮演游戏的所有内容，从角色塑造到设计战役。

书中详细介绍了每一个事件、地点和非玩家角色，我们还为您提供了全新的内容，以供在游戏中自行探索。从很多方面来说，原版战役是对本书的一次测试，在那之后，我们进行了改进和更新。如果你看过原版直播，并注意到其中存在许多不同之处（有不少），请以书中版本为准。另一方面，你应该知道自己能够改变、调整和扩展书中的材料，尤其是如果这样能为你和你的玩家建立更牢固的友谊或更好的故事。

对这本书而言，原版战役中的许多事情并不官方，德拉肯海姆中和原版战役角色密切相关的几个元素已经被修改或删除。如果你愿意，原版"德拉肯小队"的角色可能会作为冒险者对手出现在战役中。但请将他们的故事抛到一边，让你的占据舞台的中心。

Origins of the Meteor.name: 陨星起源
Origins of the Meteor.text:
"魔法会吸引更多的魔法。在极为罕见的情况下，魔法能量会结晶为妄质。这些石头慢慢地从遥远的位面、可能存在的另一个现实、不同的维度将更多原始的魔法带入我们的世界。这个比例呈现指数级增长。大量妄质周围会发生大量的能量泄露。这些混沌的能量本质上并不稳定。无法控制的魔法会随机发生相互矛盾的、难以置信的变化，留下难以磨灭的魔能污染。在不受控制的情况下，这些魔法力量化作了污霭。它们内部形成了更多妄质，让这一过程进一步加快了速度。"

- 大法师瑞安·格雷梅尔

这颗陨星留下了大量的妄质残留物，足以显现出被称为污霭的不稳定魔法场。新的妄质矿脉逐渐在污霭中成形，导致受影响的区域随着时间的推移缓慢向外扩张。如果不加以控制，污霭能够在几个世纪内席卷世界，留下一片混乱的大地，其中满是令人作呕的疯狂景象和不受控制的狂野魔法。当更具破坏性的魔法在其中不可避免地爆发时，被其感染的世界便会发生灾难性的毁灭，将充满妄质的彗星送到整个宇宙之中。在群星间的虚空中流浪了亿万年后，其中一些会与新的世界再度碰撞。而这一过程会再度开始。不计其数的世界遭遇了这样的命运，而其他世界对这种有朝一日可能会降临到它们头上的灾难一无所知。

如果不采取任何阻止扩散的措施，污霭大概会在一百五十年内完全吞噬维斯特玛。一旦到了这一步，再将它逆转的希望便十分渺茫。再有两个世纪之后，恐怖的迷雾将会笼罩整个世界。文明和社会将会分崩离析，留下一片满是怪物的废土，而一千年后，终末的灾难将会爆发。

在战役开始时，没有人知道关于污霭的全部真相，除了疯狂的低语，预言法术揭露的真相也寥寥无几。在整个冒险过程中，玩家角色可能会找到关于妄质的线索，从中他们可以发展出自己关于陨星起源的理论和推测。他们可以通过深入废墟，尤其是像是莫测之塔、陨石坑和德拉肯城堡这样的地方进行探索，从中学到许多东西。派系领袖和叛道法师也可能会提供他们的研究和见解，以帮助玩家一路前进。

Fall of House von Kessel.name: 冯·凯赛尔家族的覆灭
Fall of House von Kessel.text:
冯·凯赛尔家族在首都德拉肯海姆统治了维斯特玛长达 150 年。最后一位君主乌尔里希四世继承了一段相对政治稳定的时期，因此他的兴趣更多是在建筑、教育和风流韵事上，而非政治和战争。他娶了一位叫莱洛蕾的卡斯匹亚公主，并育有三个孩子：利奥纳德、卡塔琳娜和伊莉莎。当陨星撞击德拉肯海姆时，乌尔里希四世在位第十年。从那一天起，再也没有人见过国王、他的妻子和他们的孩子们，但他们的真实命运依然笼罩在迷雾之中。

然而，陨星落下之时，许多王室成员并不在德拉肯海姆，其中包括国王的弟妹，曼弗雷德和塞西莉亚·冯·凯赛尔。两人都曾经花费巨资请神圣之火的牧师和紫晶学院的法师用预言法术来一探究竟，但都无济于事。他们倾尽财力，发动了多次大规模的军事远征，试图夺回德拉肯海姆，但都失败了。最终，曼弗雷德确信继续努力于事无补，提出他将继承王位并搬迁首都。然而，塞西莉亚反对这一说法，辩称并没有任何确凿证据证明他们兄长和他的孩子已经身亡。贵族们在这个问题上意见不一，随之而来的是一场持续近十年的内战。当维斯特玛本身陷入政治和财政崩溃时，曼弗雷德·冯·凯赛尔和他的孩子在一次戏剧性的背叛中被刺杀。塞西莉亚·冯·凯赛尔本人在几天之后意外身亡，没有留下继承人。由于没有明确的继位者，内战在哀泣中结束了。

王室家族

由于王室成员们生前都是广为人知的公众人物，任何具有历史熟练的角色都会在艺术品或肖像中认出他们。

  • 乌尔里希·冯·凯赛尔四世陛下身材魁梧，中等身高，留着浓密的胡须，他相貌平平，但艺术作品常常会美化他的外表，让他有着英雄般的桶状胸脯、浓密的卷发和帝王般的面容。官方画作之中，他身披王家斗篷，头戴@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022]。那些了解国王的人都还记得，他是一位有能力，但过于放纵的君主，他把大多数的国家事务都交给了他的顾问们处理。
  • 莱洛蕾·冯·凯赛尔王后是一位年近三十的女性，她高 6 尺，四肢优美，头发染成了鲜艳的橙色，有着白皙的皮肤。她的脸轮廓分明，总是在不同的画中摆出不同的姿势。她身着华丽的礼服和珠宝，其中包括一条著名的金项链，其上镶嵌着十一颗绿宝石。
  • 利奥纳德·冯·凯赛尔在陨星坠落时已经十八岁了，而现在已经有三十三岁了。利奥纳德从小就对军事很感兴趣。艺术作品常常将他描绘为一位年轻的贵族军士，有着沙褐色的头发，身着巨龙图案的胸甲，手中握着一把长剑。
  • 卡塔琳娜·冯·凯赛尔在十一岁时是个好奇心旺盛的喜欢爬上爬下的孩子，有着一双大眼睛和一头赤褐色的头发。她通常穿着戴褶边的衬衫和紧身裤子而非连衣裙，还很喜欢偷帽子戴。她现在已经有二十六岁了。
  • 伊莉莎·冯·凯赛尔在灾难发生时只有六岁。这个长着纽扣般圆鼻子的孩子通常戴着帽子，穿着花纹连衣裙。如果她幸存下来，现在该有二十一岁了。

失踪已久的继承人

目前还没有人发现乌尔里希·冯·凯赛尔国王和莱洛蕾·冯·凯赛尔王后都变成了怪物。乌尔里希现在是德拉肯城堡中可怕的@UUID[Actor.FaQBcQeboMfO6hOL]的一部分，而莱洛蕾变成了一个藏在女王公园中的疯狂怪物。十五年来，没有人再见过他们的孩子们。他们是否幸存下来，而现在又在何处由你决定。

然而，除了乌尔里希四世的直系后代之外，还有许多亲属和旁支。冯·凯赛尔家族的族谱被故意模糊化了，因此你和你的玩家可以自由加入玩家角色或非玩家角色作为潜在的继承人。他们并不一定要是乌尔里希已知的子女，也可能是私生子、孙辈、侄女、侄儿或其他家族亲属。其中最戏剧性的可能性包括：

  • 一个或多个玩家角色（自己知道或不知道这件事）
  • 一位玩家角色的近亲（后代、同父异母的兄弟姐妹、堂兄或侄儿侄女）
  • @UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe]，或一位派系副手（具体点子见 NPC 条目）

此外，没有必须有一个幸存继承人的必要，甚至可以完全不存在继承人。任何人都可以说他们自己有王室血脉。但要证明这一点，并真正把王冠戴到自己头上就是另一回事了。最后，另一个贵族家族可能会获得足够的政治影响力和军事力量，将一个脆弱的宣称变成可信的宣称权，并完全取代冯·凯赛尔家族。

困难重重

在战役之初，并没有一位明显的继承人，也没有任何可信的宣称自己当拥有王位之人。潜在的王位继承人还没出现有许多原因。几十年的风流韵事、灾难和战争破坏了公共记录，通过魔法手段确定继承人需要乌尔里希四世的血液或遗骸。虽然继承人可能有一个挂饰、纹章戒指或其他文件证明，但必须要用到废墟之中的东西才能证明他们的身份和祖先。考虑引入以下额外的困难之一：

  • 被作为一位遗忘已久的囚犯，头戴铁盔一直关在@UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe]的地牢里。
  • 被收养长大，并不知晓自己双亲是谁。
  • 在烬木村当一个低贱的马房小弟。
  • 在遥远的贵族家族中被隐藏和保护起来。
  • 被石化成了德拉肯城堡中的一座雕像。
  • 意外被放逐到了另一个位面。
  • 屈服于污染，变成了怪物。
  • 一位秘密的奥术施法者，被炉明法令剥夺了继承权。（见附录 E）
  • 派系特工试图暗杀的目标，在那之后一直隐姓埋名躲藏。
  • 出生于一场风流韵事，出生被保密以掩盖丑闻。

拥抱未知

德拉肯海姆发生的一切只是一个宇宙意外。这不是某个难以理解的异位面存在有意为之，也没有任何咯咯笑的恶魔领主或阴谋邪恶神祇推动了这些事件。相反，这更像是一场自然灾害，尽管是由支撑宇宙的魔法力量引起的。就像地震、飓风或火山一样，导致这种魔法灾难的灾难性力量完全超出了凡人控制或逆转的能力。这个事实可能会让那些期望他们只需击败某个有形的邪恶实体就能拯救世界的玩家感到惊讶。然而，启发这个冒险的黑暗奇幻和宇宙恐怖文学很少以如此明确的方式结束。相反，玩家角色的英雄行为可能会避免进一步的灾难，但永远不会抹去已经造成的破坏。

虽然表面上呈现出一个诱人的谜团，但陨星更像是德拉肯海姆冲突的催化剂。我的玩家在冒险过程中未能完全揭开陨星的起源，但我们的战役仍然有一个非常令人满意的结局。事实上，当真正的答案从未被完全理解时，宇宙恐怖和疯狂的主题会大大增强。

德拉肯海姆信物

这六件奇物被委托给了维斯特玛皇家议会。每一个都标志着持有者是重要的行政和政治魁首。除了它们强大的魔法力量之外（见附录 D），这些信物还在特殊的加冕仪式上有着重要的作用，即让新君主与@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022]同调（见第 9 章）。因此，许多派系都在寻找这些被认为已经失落在废墟之中的信物。然而，其中一些已经被派系特工所寻得！以下是你能找到它们的地方：

议长徽章。巴林·巴瑟斯没能逃出德拉肯海姆，而是被变成了一只怪物。这个变异的可怜家伙仍然带着@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.ChaT000000000016]，在蓄水池下的巢穴深处为可怕的"女公爵"服务。

莫测之杖。德拉肯海姆的大法师阿德里亚纳·莫蒂耶纳死在了莫测之塔中。这根强大的法杖时至今日仍然留在塔中。按照传统，紫晶学院有权决定谁持有这根法杖。

司令证章。艾利亚斯·德雷克希尔总司令在德拉肯海姆沦陷之后幸存下来，在执掌覆影明灯之前，他在内战中战斗了多年。他仍然保留着自己原来的证章。

圣维特鲁维奥护身符。高阶圣火守护者格雷格拉带领信徒们躲进了圣维特鲁维奥教堂。她的真实命运无人知晓。但现在，教堂中有一头可怕的加米尔犬怪祭司佩戴着护身符。按照传统，它会被托付给德拉肯海姆神圣之火的最高神职人员，同时这件物品本身也是圣维特鲁维奥的遗物之一。

间谍总管的印戒。间谍总管玛格达莱娜·瓦萨里是一位半精灵刺客。作为一位全心全意忠于王室的特工，瓦萨里在内战期间假装身亡，暗中寻找任何幸存的王室继承人。如果不是几年前她被杀害，而印戒被盗贼女王偷走，她可能已经成功了。

总管印章。王室总管约翰·艾斯纳在没能救出乌尔里希四世后被困在德拉肯城堡中。然而，他委托年幼的女儿藏起他的印章，以防再次陷入这种困境。虽然她的命运如今无人知晓，但这枚印章现在是寰宇钟楼中@UUID[Actor.PiuU7fM0cJ07APjq]的珍宝之一。

Running Personal Quests.name: 运作个人任务
Running Personal Quests.text:
这些冒险动机为玩家提供了进入废墟冒险的个人动机。玩家可以选择第一章中提供的任务之一，或者你也可以和玩家一同创造一个。

个人任务一直是开放式的，所以你可以和你的玩家一同深度定制他们。在这个过程中，你能够自由地加入意想不到的曲折或复杂情节，并和城市、事件、派系建立牢固联系。以下是关于如何进行这些任务的一些建议：

寻找治疗。角色的亲属可能在浓厚污霭的深处被找到：靠近莫测之塔、女王公园、陨石坑或者被"女公爵"或@UUID[Actor.uMQvgbPhxlHLl1vG]所奴役。不幸的是，他们已经陷入疯狂，被发现后会抗拒抓捕，并不断试图逃走。怪物变化有三种方式可以逆转：使用@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{祈愿术}法术，通过@UUID[Actor.tqJK1mzxPst0xV08]进行神圣干预，或者研究@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.SipT000000000011]法术。

夺取王位。这一任务将角色与战役中的一场核心冲突紧密联系在一起。一个有趣的转折是引入一位具有同样宣称的冒险者对手。你可以查阅这一部分以获得更详细的信息。这个角色甚至可能是乌尔里希四世的一个孩子。

灾难幻象。角色需要找到在城市污染最为严重的区域生存的方法。当他们抵达陨石坑中心时，这位角色会在触摸妄质之心时看到另一个末日的幻象。角色必须决定他们将如何拯救世界。

派系野心家。在一个派系中晋升需要角色的全面投入，并拒绝其他派系。当一位派系领袖将角色视作一个有能力、值得信赖的亲信，并任命他们为自己的得力助手时，这一任务就会完成。这项任务最具挑战性的方面是它可能会和其他玩家角色造成利益冲突，但请将这种冲突视作角色之间的分歧点所在！

项上人头。这是一项非常困难的个人任务，但却是最直截了当的一个。派系领袖都被严密保护，且他们自己也十分强大。尽管艾利亚斯·德雷克希尔和希奥多·马歇尔更容易见到，以@UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe]或@UUID[Actor.IFRQ1jK41KOQNjGl]为目标的角色则会面临棘手的挑战！

奥术秘密。这些法术可以从@UUID[Actor.jfJGagVOoUgyCyxn]、@UUID[Actor.uMQvgbPhxlHLl1vG]、@UUID[Actor.8mw3Q1D3NIIXIlSg]那里和莫测之塔中存放的法术书中学得，角色必须从其中每一处获得知识。收集这些法术会引起紫晶学院的怒火，他们希望独占这些魔法秘密的知识。角色们学会@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.ConT000000000002]法术时，任务便会完成。

枯败之地。在造访每一处地区之后，角色们可以分别学会制作@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.AquT000000000001]、@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.NeuT000000000006]和@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.ConT000000000001]法术，哪怕他们并没有满足学会这些法术的先决条件。

家族事务。被俘虏或加入派系的亲属会在一处派系据点被发现。他们可能是该派系的一位副手！说服他们离开十分困难，他们必须亲眼见到这一派系做了一些可怕的事情。

负债压身。冒险者对手、女王的弟兄们的突击小队或一位刺客正在追猎角色的赏金。你可能会想让@UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe]或紫晶学院"获得"角色的债务，以此作为对他们施加影响！

丢失的传家宝。任何稀有的魔法物品都可以是这件传家宝，你可以选择城市中失物的所在地点，不过苇叶宅邸、克莱恩伯格庄园或戮石广场都是很好的选择。如果你确实想制造些难题，这间物品可能会被盗贼女王或冒险者对手偷走，它甚至可能是德拉肯海姆的信物之一。

个人朝圣。角色希望在每个地点进行的仪式并不简单。相反，正是一个消耗时间的过程，需要少见的祭品，并花费数个小时才能完成，又或者它只能在一天之中的某个时间（黎明或黄昏时分）进行。因此，角色需要盟友的保护和支持才能在仪式期间保持安全。

怪物杀手。合适的敌人包括@UUID[Actor.wguXXOlJxvHZw7xo]、@UUID[Actor.PiuU7fM0cJ07APjq]、"女公爵"、@UUID[Actor.CF7PHcpwR43Z2LVS]、屠戮王子、一头@UUID[Actor.nqdTPETJHquUMVIW]或一头@UUID[Actor.uXmefMFY5tadWoMU]。

完成个人任务

如第一章所述，完成个人任务后，玩家角色将会获得奖励。此外，你应当根据你使用的升级方式奖励队伍中的每一位角色经验值。

根据你的选择，当角色完成个人任务后，你可以和玩家合作，为他们创建反映角色正在进行和发展的故事的后续个人任务，此外，如果出现角色无法完成或决定放弃个人任务的情况，你应当和玩家合作创造一个新的个人任务。

创造定制个人任务

当设计一个定制的个人任务时，请考虑以下几点：

  • 任务应当需要角色们探索内城废墟中的一个或多个地点。一位角色不该过早完成他们的个人任务，而涉及德拉肯城堡的任务可能需要到战役后期才能完成。
  • 它应当会给其中某派系带来复杂的情节，可能需要角色寻求该派系的帮助才能完成任务。
  • 任务应当是具体的、可实现的，和角色升级无关（如达到第十级或获得特定专长）。
  • 个人任务中要小心使用"滴答作响的时钟"。虽然这可能会带来令人带入的紧迫感，但你应当更着重于长期目标，而非某件非常紧迫的事情。

玩家经常建议的个人任务涉及失踪人员、丢失物品或复仇。许多提供的示例个人任务已经涵盖了这些动机，如"家族事务"、"丢失的传家宝"和"项上人头"。请玩家先考虑这些选项。也许他们的想法可以很容易地适应这些任务中的一个（反之亦然）。

Running the Factions.name: 运作派系
Running the Factions.text:
五个派系在争夺德拉肯海姆的控制权：覆影明灯、女王的弟兄们、白银骑士团、天火信众和紫晶学院。每一个都由一位杰出的派系领袖指挥，但派系本身作为一个整体会表现得像一位反复出现的重要 NPC，只是他们由许多在一起工作的个体组成，他们有相同的意识形态、目标、理念和资源。第三章：派系中描述了其背景、目标、角色扮演特点、主要 NPC 和每个派系的长处。使用这些信息，你可以决定派系在德拉肯海姆冒险期间如何帮助或阻碍玩家角色。

如果玩家角色希望寻得德拉肯海姆最伟大的秘密和宝藏，他们就必须在充满阴谋、谈判、破裂和暴力冲突的错综复杂的罗网中做到游刃有余，而不仅仅是将派系团结起来对抗一个共同的敌人。他们和每个派系之间的关系都会随着角色的选择而自然发展变化，但最终，他们自己将决定是加入哪个派系，又和哪个派系为敌。因此，每一个派系都可能成为支持冒险团队的后盾、激烈的竞争对手、亲密的盟友、不死不休的敌手或介于这些之间的任何角色。

如果没有一个或多个派系的的支持（或者惹恼他们），探索德拉肯海姆最为危险之地将会举步维艰。相应的，派系需要玩家角色的帮助来完成他们在城市中的目标，并为他们的盟友提供奖励，协助玩家角色完成个人任务。相反，敌对的派系会在整场战役中用自己的手段对抗角色，并产生动态的问题和新的复杂情况。无论哪种方式，派系最好以一种被动的方式进行运作。当角色们试图谈判时，他们的领袖会提出坚定的要求，而当角色们挫败他们的计划时，他们会策划反击，当角色们阻碍他们的目标时，他们也会破坏角色们的行动。

最终，这些互动可能会发展成派系之间的全面敌对。一旦发生这样的情况，你的目标是让派系尽可能长时间发挥作用。如果玩家和多个派系敌对，也不要害怕让他们不知所措。你的玩家会找到令人惊讶的方式来挫败派系，并在和他们合作时制定出狡猾的计划。通过回以新的挑战来应对他们的创造力，当玩家成功时，你可以通过让盟友认可他们的成就，进而奖励他们。各个派系都配备了能够帮助你以有趣的方式升级紧张局势，以有趣的方式增加利害关系冲突的工具。

许多冒险地点都提供了与派系相关的冒险动机和任务，你可以使用这些动机和任务来让角色们拜访每个区域。每个地点还详细说明了各个派系如何应对看发生的事件和结果。

登场角色表

艾利亚斯·德雷克希尔总司令
（覆影明灯的严厉领袖）

安松·朗上尉
（坚定的覆影明灯副官）

佩特拉·朗中尉
（乐观的覆影明灯副官）

骑士统领希奥多·马歇尔
（英勇的白银骑士团领袖）

高阶圣火守护者奥菲利亚·苇叶
（忠诚的白银骑士团副官）

大法师埃德瑞克·符文织者
（精于算计的紫晶学院领袖）

川流
（务实的紫晶学院副手）

卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯
（天火信众的神秘先知）

那萨利尔·燧石
（热诚的天火信众副手）

盗贼女王
（难以捉摸的犯罪首脑）

"黑杰克"梅尔
（卑鄙的"女王的弟兄们"二把手）

乌尔里希·冯·凯赛尔四世国王
（德拉肯海姆的君主，被认为已死）

莱洛蕾·冯·凯赛尔王后
（王后，被认为已死）

利奥纳德，卡塔琳娜和伊莉莎·冯·凯赛尔
（皇室继承人，命运未知）

缔结同盟

尽管他们之间存在冲突，但派系领导人知道他们无法独自达成目标。他们不仅会寻求玩家角色的帮助，许多派系也看到了相互合作的好处。擅长斡旋的角色可以在两个（或多个）派系之间缔结同盟、休战或停火。说服两个派系搁置分歧，勠力同心是一件困难的事情，但也能够实现。为了促成这样的盟约，角色需要向他们展示结盟将会如何帮助两边实现彼此的目标，同时也会根据两派及其领袖的扮演特征、理想、牵绊和缺陷对症下药。这些紧张的谈判可能会成为战役中最令人难忘的时刻，因此潜在的结盟最好安排在最戏剧的地点，如派系据点和圣维特鲁维奥大教堂。

这些派系设计让任意两个派系之间的长期同盟都是可以实现的，而涉及第三个派系的短期休战虽困难，但并非无法实现。在你的战役中，困难会出现无数情况，导致派系需要重新评估他们的优先事项，聪明而善言的玩家可能会提出令人信服的论据。但要记住，派系是由人组成的，而人们并非时时刻刻都以合乎逻辑的方式行事。无论如何，这些同盟都并不稳固，因为每个派系都会优先考虑自己的目标。除非玩家角色不断努力维持，否则派系之间的结盟都将不可避免地走向崩溃。

像紫晶学院或女王的弟兄们这样的派系甚至可能利用结盟作为方便的机会来操纵玩家角色和其他派系，甚至可能会在关键时刻戏剧性地背叛。特别狡猾的角色可能会帮助派系编织这样的阴谋诡计，促成对毫无戒心的盟友的残酷背叛，从而让派系能完全控制德拉肯海姆。由于背叛的威胁如此真实，在多个派系之间建立同盟的玩家角色可能会损害他们与单个派系之间的信任。他们不会得到派系所能提供的最大收益，派系特工也不会信任掌握敏感信息的角色。派系领袖对双重间谍持谨慎态度，他们更希望看到玩家角色对他们做出忠诚的承诺。因此，玩家角色应当被不断召见去证明自己的忠诚。

解决冲突

对玩家角色来说不幸的是，探索妄质的全部属性和陨星的起源并不能团结各个派系。相反，这些发现将会在躁动的派系之间进一步制造隔阂，因为他们在解决问题的最佳手段上存在严重的分歧。考虑到污霭可能席卷整个世界，白银骑士团会首先认为摧毁这些晶体完全正确。然而，在整个战役过程中，完成这项任务的合理性应当自始至终受到怀疑。你应当努力将他们的观点和紫晶学院理性但可疑的立场——他们坚持认为魔法的手段能够将妄质无害化，防止进一步的灾难，以及天火信众的狂热和末日预言进行对比。每当玩家似乎已经下定决心时，敌对的派系都应当表现出一种令人心痒的感觉，即替代方案可能依然存在。你应当避免给出任何"准确的"答案：结果究竟如何，取决于角色如何将其拼凑在一起，得出自己的结论，以及如何采取行动。

因此，派系冲突没有固定的解决方法。战役结束时，几个派系可能会被完全赶出德拉肯海姆，他们的领袖被杀死，据点被拔起。虽然现在德拉肯堡的决战不可避免，但谁会参加这场战斗以及可能出现的结果是不可预见的。第十章：德拉肯海姆的命运描述了其中一些可能性。

"许多人似乎都希望在这座城市中找到活着的王室成员，仿佛这就能解决一切问题似的。首先，他们并没有那么好，其次，他们还活着的几率...令人沮丧。"

——塞巴斯蒂安·克劳

Rival Adventurers.name: 对手冒险者
Rival Adventurers.text:
德拉肯海姆吸引来了各种各样未来的英雄和财宝猎人。在战役中，无论是废墟之中还是在烬木村上，角色们都经常可能遇到这些对手冒险者作为 NPC 反复出现。在任何时间，都可能会有多达十几支队伍在探索德拉肯海姆，甚至可能还有更多。

竞争对手可能好斗、喜欢争吵，也可能是友好而有风度的。无论哪种，好的对手都会激励角色们行动起来，创造独特的角色扮演机会。你甚至可以邀请玩家们在角色创建过程中在他们的角色和对手之间建立预先存在的关系。友好的对手冒险者可能会以以下方式和角色们互动：

  • 鼓励角色们讲述自己的故事和事迹
  • 与角色们分享谣言和八卦
  • 建议角色们访问特定冒险地点或进行新的任务
  • 在一项比试之中挑战角色们（如射箭、摔跤、魔术表演、喝酒、杀死怪物、寻找宝藏或一场比武）
  • 和角色们合作完成一个困难的目标

又或者，一些对手冒险者对玩家角色更具有敌意：

  • 在烬木村飙垃圾话和羞辱角色们
  • 贬低角色们的成就，侮辱他们的技能
  • 完成角色们忽视的任务，探索他们忽视的地点
  • 充当敌对派系的增援部队
  • 拿走角色们的赏金

各个派系都常常会雇佣冒险队伍来帮助他们实现目标。如果玩家角色不接受任务或招募，派系领袖可能会转而雇佣对手冒险者！也可能在开始的时候对手冒险者是队伍的朋友或敌人，而战役结束的时候截然相反！

对手冒险者队伍

你可以使用下文的范例冒险队伍，也可以创造设计你自己的小队。当你创造你自己的冒险队伍时，可以使用核心规则中预设的资料卡，而非像玩家角色一样耗费时间为这些 NPC 制作角色卡。要创造一个好对手，有趣的角色扮演特征远比游戏资料卡重要。当对手反映出玩家角色自身的个性和缺陷，在共享一些共同点的同时，将他们最好和最坏的品质放大到极致时，他们表现会尤为出色。与这些特征截然相反则会创造出对头，而非对手。你可以通过从本书中介绍的背景或个人任务中引入一两个角色扮演特征来塑造这些角色。

"我最喜欢的游戏就是告诉一群冒险者城市里的宝藏在哪里。老实说，我不知道宝藏在哪里，但现在他们会绕着我走了。"

——塞巴斯蒂安·克劳

卡斯匹亚探险队

这支探险队由一个卡斯匹亚家族派遣。

  • 朱庇特·琼斯是一位虎背熊腰的人类@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.fsPruAIDOg4tVrgb]{角斗士}，他的下巴轮廓分明，看上去力大无穷。尽管他声称自己在德拉肯海姆的冒险是为了给自己的名字挣来荣耀，但他实际上是在进行一次个人任务，以证明自己的家族和冯·凯赛尔家族的亲戚关系，因为他实际上是莱洛蕾女王的侄儿。
  • 乐明顿·威斯哈弗，一个油腻、厌世、爱哭鼻子的侏儒吟游诗人（使用@UUID[Actor.RSVYdtx9l6jQkjiV]{诈术师}的资料卡，但他的法术由法师法术改为吟游诗人法术）作为队伍的传令官。
  • 一群由十二个@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.Cy3A0rsNMPLZozam]{暴徒}组成的家族私人护卫。

英勇老兵

这支冒险小队在德拉肯海姆小有名气。其成员包括：

  • 普鲁托·杰克逊，一位人类@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.D5UqYD1EnTrJaMTO]{骑士}。这位鲁莽的卡斯匹亚王子来到德拉肯海姆表面是为了杀死这座城市中最强大的怪物，以扬名立万。实际上，他正在寻找自己的外甥是王位合法继承人的证据。
  • 维奥·斯耶纳，一位猫人@UUID[Actor.02VvEfOHseDs38Jm]城市游侠{城市游侠}。这只脏兮兮的猫儿已经在德拉肯海姆生存了 15 年，比任何人都更了解这座城市。她正在寻找自己失踪父亲的蛛丝马迹。
  • 塞巴斯蒂安·克劳，一位半精灵@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.mQnsXanewsPiV7QE]{魔法师 }。这个爱管闲事，自信过度的学院辍学生被陨星的噩梦所困扰。

无畏探险家

这几位老朋友多年以来一直在冒险。他们包括一位@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.kz1t6xeXVwODpYb2]{狂战士}、一位@UUID[Actor.8L0mVQGiB3Tbu00H]{乡野法师}、一位@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.J8xjoG4Dxb8WkHtV]{老兵}、一位@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.PVD5wRdyO7iCJPs1]{祭司}和一位@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.13K3XK2A3wwxVKLD]{密探}。

鲁莽菜鸟

这些新来者可能在德拉肯海姆活不了一天，但他们很有勇气！这只队伍由一位@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.CHEUjiYrVM9X0vIT]{侍僧}、一位@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.E9CvDPDg5dFEpVjS]{警卫}、一位@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.GlaCGcgIP6YjBjGc]{贵族}和一位@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.O3ABqI55Ir1du1Xa]{斥候}组成。

Starting the Campaign.name: Starting the Campaign
Starting the Campaign.text:
You can begin characters at 1st or 3rd level. We strongly recommend holding a Session Zero before starting the campaign. During this special session, make sure you achieve the following:

  • Generate the player characters. Present players with the information included in the introduction to this book, especially the “Character Creation” section.
  • Share the appendices “The World of Drakkenheim” and “Character Backgrounds” with players who want to create characters with well-established connections to the setting.
  • Allow each player to choose a personal quest by sharing the table or cards with them. Remember, they need not disclose these to each other.
  • Ask the players to decide how their characters met and why they're working together. You can use the “Road to Drakkenheim” adventure below to bring the characters tothe city itself.
  • Distribute one rumour to each player character using the tables or cards.
  • Share the Poster Map of Drakkenheim with the players.

In addition, Session Zero is an important opportunity to establish a few expectations with your players about the campaign. We've created a video guide to Session Zero on our YouTube channel! Beyond scheduling and table etiquette, you should cover a few topics specific to this campaign:

  • Discuss the themes of dark fantasy with your players by reviewing the content warning provided in the introductionof this book.
  • Highlight the warnings in the “Dangers of the Dark City” section in the introduction. You may wish to present the full rules for contamination to your players from Appendix C.
  • Players might react to the rules for contamination and the Haze by asking questions about whether or not their character abilities can protect them from these effects. Even if they propose something inventive, your answer should be a firm “no”. Instead, explain they may discover new ways to overcome these problems during the adventure.
  • Remind your players the adventure occurs entirely within the bounds of Drakkenheim and its immediate environs. While the wider world gives context to the story, travelling outside Drakkenheim is beyond the scope of the campaign. Make a friendly agreement with your players that no matter what happens, their characters won't leave the area. If conditions emerge where it would make sense for a player character to depart the city, the player should play a new character until their previous one returns to Drakkenheim.

After you've finished your Session Zero, begin your first game session with the introductory adventure, “The Road to Drakkenheim”.

Alternate Opening: Faction Contact

If you're beginning at 3rd level, you may instead begin the campaign with the player characters in direct contact with a faction lieutenant, who has hired them for a job in the Outer City described in chapter 6. We began the original Dungeons of Drakkenheim campaign with characters meeting River of the Amethyst Academy at Eckerman Mill, who hired them to recover a delerium crystal from the ruins of the Rat's Nest Tavern.

The Road to Drakkenheim.name: The Road to Drakkenheim
The Road to Drakkenheim.text:
“You couldn't pay me any amount of money to go into that city, but there are people willing to risk it for the right price. Those people gotta eat, and honest folk can make good profit feeding them. Still, there's bastards who just wanna take it. That's where you come in.”

— Eren Marlowe, Provisioner

If you wish to start with characters at 1st level and ease them into the campaign as a whole, begin with this short prelude. In this introduction, the characters are making their way towards Drakkenheim for the first time, accompanying a supply caravan bound for Emberwood Village. You can also use this opening to start characters at 3rd level, but you may wish to raise the difficulty of these encounters by adding additional creatures.

Adventure Hook

Supplies for Emberwood Village. Though each has their own reasons for venturing into Drakkenheim, the characters have been hired by Eren Marlowe (a human @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]) to guard their caravan after the last group they hired stiffed them at the last minute. They'll pay each character 25 gold for the trip upon arrival in Emberwood Village. It's the perfect way to make some money as characters trek towards the city. The characters meet Eren Marlowe in the city of Altberg, which is the closest large city to Drakkenheim. It's a three week journey to the ruins.

Eren Marlowe

Eren Marlowe is a lean person in their mid-forties with shoulder-length brown hair under a leather cap. They wear a slightly shabby woolen traveller's jacket and well-worn slacks. Chatty yet professional and with an opinion about everything, they enjoy having company on the road as much as they enjoy having the extra protection. As the characters travel along the road, Eren Marlowe asks each of them about their reasons for travelling to Drakkenheim, and how the characters met each other. This is a perfect opportunity to introduce the player characters, their relationships, and personal quests. In turn, Marlowe can share the following information with characters:

  • They are bound for Emberwood Village, which is the only settlement within two weeks' travel of Drakkenheim that hasn't been abandoned. It is about five miles south of the dark city.
  • The increasing number of fortune-seekers, mercenaries, and prospectors exploring the ruins has turned the sleepy village into a boom town again.
  • Most farms and villages within one hundred miles of Drakkenheim have been abandoned. Crops and livestock don't grow anymore as the water and soil are contaminated by foul magic.
  • The folk of Emberwood Village rely on outside supplies entirely. Flamekeeper Hanna, a priest of the Sacred Flame, provides seed funds to attract the caravanners.
  • Once they arrive, Eren Marlowe will stay in Emberwood Village for a few weeks selling goods.
  • If characters are interested in heading into Drakkenheim, Marlowe offers to introduce them to their friend and frequent business partner, Armin Gainsbury, who runs a supply company in Emberwood Village. Armin sells useful adventuring equipment and can provide good advice about exploring the ruins.

Events on the Road

While most of the journey is uneventful, once characters are a few days from Drakkenheim, read:

After two weeks travelling on the road, the countryside turns dreary and desaturated. You pass many abandoned villages with dilapidated homes, crumbling farmsteads with sallow empty fields, and forests of dead trees. Thorny brambles and harsh scrubgrass are all that grow along the mud-slick road. Drizzling rain fills most days, and the wind howls at night. Aside from the creaking wagon wheels, you only hear the cawing of crows.

Marlowe's Caravan

Eren sits atop a large covered wagon pulled by two @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.Bupo3E9X5Ptx6XeT]{Draft Horses}. It's packed with common provisions and trade goods: flour, salt, dried fruits, preserved meats, several jars of sauerkraut, a few casks of mead, a case of cheap wine, and a barrel of fresh water. The wagon also packs a few sets of common artisan's tools, cook's utensils, empty waterskins, climber's kits, rope, and mining tools. Marlowe carries two @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.ytlsBjYsZ7OBSEBs]{Potions of Healing} on their person for emergencies, and an extra light crossbow. Beneath a hidden plank in the wagon is a locked chest that contains 200 gold.

Bandit Shakedown

“Oi, oi! Hold there, friends… you're travelling on a royal road, eh? In these troubled times it falls to loyal servants like ourselves to keep these highways free of reprobates and outlaws, eh? I'm afraid we'll need to collect a fee to ensure your safe passage to the capital, eh?”

During one afternoon on the road, several cutthroats emerge from the ditches and rubble of a nearby farmhouse with crossbows at the ready.

Bogdan, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.Cy3A0rsNMPLZozam] mounted on a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.rz8UTUnFT87BsAFR], leads four @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.n4TEv7inVUkyZviN]{Bandits}: Hosh, Mildred, Sanna, and Mudface. They demand the horses, all the booze in the wagon, a pound of food each, and a payment of 25 gold per character (including Eren Marlowe).

Negotiation. The bandits can be talked down with three successful Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, or Persuasion) checks (in any combination). It's DC 10 if the characters offer to pay the bandits something, but DC 15 if they try to convince the bandits to walk away empty-handed but alive. However, after three failed checks, the bandits are convinced the characters are full of hot air and won't entertain any further negotiations.

Combat. If it comes down to a fight, the bandits try to gang up on the most vulnerable target. Then, Bogdan threatens to finish off an unconscious character unless his demands are met. Otherwise, the brigands disengage when wounded. They flee if one-third of their number are killed and none of the player characters are downed.

Developments. These bandits are only loosely associated with the Queen's Men and don't venture into Drakkenheim themselves. If captured or questioned, they don't know anything about the Queen's Men or Drakkenheim that isn't common knowledge. They have a hideout in an old barn a few miles off the road. If the characters follow up, the barn is guarded by six @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.n4TEv7inVUkyZviN]{Bandits}. It contains their spoils: 75 gold in trade goods and coins and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.ytlsBjYsZ7OBSEBs].

“Sneaking and skulking is the preferred method, second best is having someone like me around.”

— Pluto Jackson

A Night on the Road

A trio of harrowed adventurers approach the characters' campsite on the last night of their journey. They are tired, hungry, and hoping for a place to rest. They are leaving Drakkenheim after failing their quests and losing two of their other companions. They are bitter, defeated, cynical, and never plan to return, but share one or more rumours about the city as they sit and share stories by the fire. They are hesitant to talk about their fallen friends, but suggest watching out for the rats in Drakkenheim. They include:

  • Ludwig von Graff, a penniless human @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.GlaCGcgIP6YjBjGc] who was trying to find the deed to his ancestral estate.
  • Endra Jansen, a human @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.O3ABqI55Ir1du1Xa] who was seeking fortune to pay off an old debt.
  • Rikard Vos, a human @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.J8xjoG4Dxb8WkHtV] who survived the civil war and had returned to Drakkenheim searching for lost family members.

Vos has accumulated five levels of contamination and is now incapacitated. He follows his companions in a daze, and cannot speak as his tongue has rotted out from a rasping mutation. His friends have covered him in a heavy cloak to conceal his wasting mutation and the tentacled limb growing in place of his left arm.

If the characters detect Vos' mutations or pry the adventurers about his illnesses, they confess that he became sick after picking up one of the strange crystals in Drakkenheim. They insist the illness is not contagious, but rather caused by overexposure to the contaminated magic in Drakkenheim. They've heard expensive magical medicine might be able to help, but they can't afford it. Instead, they're hoping he'll get better once they bring him far away from the city.

Unfortunately, during the night, Rikard Vos succumbs to contamination and transforms into a @UUID[Actor.jWhywrjRVft3DkSx]{Tentacled Delerium Dreg}. The monster flies into a rage and attacks one of its former companions. It's up to the characters to decide how to intervene. The creature is beyond reason and attacks unceasingly until killed. If von Graff and Jansen survive, they are deeply troubled by this incident. They solemnly warn the characters about the horrors of the city as they set off in the morning.

Marlowe has heard stories about contamination and delerium, but never witnessed it firsthand. They note that handling delerium should be done with extreme care, and that far more terrible creatures are said to dwell in Drakkenheim, many the result of those who suffered a similar fate as Rikard Vos.

Conclusion

Marlowe has no intention of turning back, and insists the caravan press on towards Emberwood Village (described in chapter 4). In town, they will meet agents of the five factions, detailed in the next chapter.

Rumours (d100).name: Rumours (d100)
Rumours (d100).text:
Rumours (d100)

Rumours offer characters clues about Drakkenheim and prompts which encourage them to freely explore the ruins to see what they can find. A few rumours are true, some of them are somewhat misleading, and others are entirely false. Regardless, there is always value in looking into a rumour, as each will lead to great adventures! Here are a few suggestions for when characters might find a rumour:

  • During downtime in Emberwood Village
  • Written on the walls of Eckerman Mill
  • Clues found in a random encounter
  • Interacting with rival adventurers

You can choose one of the rumours or rollone randomly on the table below:

Chapter 2- Running the Campaign.name: Chapter 2- Running the Campaign
Chapter 2- Running the Campaign.text:
Chapter 2:
Running the Campaign

Dungeons of Drakkenheim is a nonlinear adventure that combines urban exploration and faction conflict, bound together by the personal quests of the player characters. Early in the campaign, your players might closely follow the story overview described below. As they advance further into the city and interact with the factions, their decisions will reshape the story in unpredictable ways.

This book contains inspiration, guidelines, and tools to help you adjudicate and respond to your player characters' actions as they explore Drakkenheim. Running an exciting and dynamic nonlinear adventure requires sound judgement and good use of logic on your part. You should feel empowered to make changes so your players have a rewarding and challenging experience. Occasionally, you may even need to devise your own material or repurpose adventure hooks, characters, and locations to better suit the changing conditions in your campaign.

Story Overview

The characters arrive in Drakkenheim to pursue their personal quests or a few freelance missions from friendly contacts in Emberwood Village. They face ravenous @UUID[Actor.v6osXCahFwmobuQz]{Ratlings}, malfeasant wizards, and rival adventurers in the Outer City Ruins. During their first forays into the city, the characters witness the strange magic of delerium and contend with the mysterious Haze. The threat of contamination makes survival in Drakkenheim difficult and dangerous. The characters may seek assistance and resources from the five factions to accomplish their goals and find a way deeper into the city.

As the characters learn more about the factions' differing ideologies, the various faction leaders take notice of their progress. Once the characters successfully traverse the City Walls and begin exploring the Inner City Ruins, each leader approaches the characters for help with their objectives. They appeal to the characters' Ideals and Bonds, offer resources and support, and promise crucial assistance with the characters' personal quests.

However, as the characters collaborate with the factions to advance their mutual goals, they become increasingly entangled in the political machinations between the competing groups. Each organization has a different vision for the future of Drakkenheim, and the tenuous peace won't last much longer. Nevertheless, with the support of one or more of these groups, the characters can explore dangerous Inner City locations such as the Cathedral of Saint Vitruvio, the Inscrutable Tower of the Amethyst Academy, or perhaps even mount an expedition into the Crater. Characters may unearth stunning revelations from Drakkenheim's past and recover powerful artefact which threaten the balance of power between the factions. They might even discover how the Haze threatens to engulf the world itself.

The factions are deeply divided over what must be done to solve these problems. As a result, simmering tensions boil over into outright conflict. As the city streets become a battlefield between the organizations, the faction leaders each demand the characters' loyalty. Now, the characters must decide which factions are their allies, and which are their enemies. Eventually, the unraveling situation may require the characters to act directly against one or more of the factions, who respond with counterstrikes of their own. In turn, the characters may launch major assaults against enemy factions to destroy their strongholds, defeat their leaders, and drive them out of Drakkenheim. As the conflict reaches its zenith, the surviving factions set their master plans into motion, requiring an expedition into Castle Drakken. There, a final showdown will decide the fate of Drakkenheim.

Character Advancement.name: Character Advancement
Character Advancement.text:
Character advancement in Drakkenheim may be handled by using traditional experience points. In addition to earning XP for defeating monsters, you should award additional experience points (equal to the reward for defeating a level-appropriate monster) whenever characters:

  • Finish a personal quest
  • Complete a faction mission
  • Slay a legendary monster (either a monster or faction leader)
  • Obtain a Seal of Drakkenheim or a Relic of Saint Vitruvio
  • Discover secret information about the meteoror Drakkenheim

Alternatively, you can choose to dispense with tracking experience points and simply decide when the characters gain a level.

This flowchart shows a possible path characters may take through their adventures in Drakkenheim, along with suggested levels to provide an appropriate challenge for the characters. Use this as a guideline for how fast characters should advance, and award character levels when they complete a personal quest or major faction mission.

Adventure Flowchart

Deadly Challenges

Drakkenheim is a dangerous place. Not every combat encounter is fairly balanced in a level-appropriate manner. Deadly threats lurk down every street, and many scenarios intentionally stack the odds against the player characters. They must use cunning, ingenuity, and teamwork to survive and seek the aid of the factions to accomplish their most important goals.

Character Death

Characters looking to revive a slain companion have limited options. Few non-player characters are capable of casting the necessary spells, and the expensive material components are rare. Prominent members of the Silver Order and the Followers of the Falling Fire can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.AGFMPAmuzwWO6Dfz] and other higher level spells. Consult the Faction Boons section in chapter 3 regarding each respective faction for details on what each faction requires. Characters might also seek out the druid of the Shrine of Morrigan (see chapter 6). Finally, spell scrolls of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.LmRHHMtplpxr9fX6], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.AGFMPAmuzwWO6Dfz], and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jhhT9PsHy5A7EojO] may be found as treasure in various locations in the city, usually the chapels and cathedrals. At your option, the characters may find another scroll elsewhere in the ruins.

Regardless, the players may need to create a replacement character, or play one temporarily. A player may easily create a new arrival to Emberwood Village to replace a slain character, or perhaps be encountered as the lone survivor of another adventuring party. Alternatively, they might play a faction member assigned to the party as a reinforcement.

“My best tip for staying alive in Drakkenheim is to just kill everything that moves. No time to ask questions. Hesitation is dangerous.”

— Sebastian Crowe

Chapter 3- Factions.name: 派系
Chapter 3- Factions.text:
Chapter 3: Factions

This chapter describes the roleplaying characteristics, resources, and major NPCs for each of the five factions. Each dossier is broken down into the following sections:

Background

This details a brief history of each faction and its recent activities in Drakkenheim.

Objectives

These describe the faction's major goals in Drakkenheim. Most concern two core conflicts that define the campaign: Who should control Drakkenheim? What should be done about delerium? Conflict is inevitable because every faction desires very different outcomes with regard to these questions. All wish to control the ruins and decide how delerium will be used (or destroyed). In addition, some factions have additional objectives which may directly oppose those of a rival faction.

Each faction's Roleplaying Characteristics resonate strongly with their Objectives. However, a faction may tolerate setting aside or even adjusting its objectives if it perceives a chance for greater gain in the future; if acting on its objectives would incite overwhelming retribution from political forces beyond Drakkenheim; or if circumstances emerge where achieving its objectives would contradict the faction's own ideals. In such a situation, a faction might even modify its objectives. Player characters might create alliances or expose weaknesses in the factions by taking advantage of this fact.

Key Figures

Each faction has two major NPCs: the faction leader and their lieutenant(s). The stat blocks for these characters are detailed in Appendix B, and their roleplay traits are provided here. Use these NPCs as the player characters' primary points-of-contact during faction interactions such as:

  • Briefing or hiring the characters for a mission,
  • Meetings and diplomatic negotiations,
  • Sharing information, advice, and creating mutual plans,
  • Offering rewards or resources to the player characters on behalf of the faction.

Faction Leader

A formidable legendary non-player character commands each faction. These faction leaders issue orders to faction agents, direct faction resources, and make the final decision on how the faction acts in all matters. Each has their own individual Personality Traits, Ideals, Bonds, and Flaws, and perhaps a few dark secrets too! As conflict in Drakkenheim escalates, the player characters should interact with the faction leaders often, and might even bring several faction leaders together for negotiations.

The faction leaders spend most of their time coordinating strategy and logistics within their faction stronghold. They are the organizational lynchpin for their entire faction, and rarely take to the field. A faction leader should only personally venture into Drakkenheim for a major gathering or offensive involving the cathedral, Castle Drakken, or a faction stronghold. The risk to the faction is simply too great to risk their lives in the field otherwise.

If a faction leader is slain or permanently incapacitated, the faction must withdraw from Drakkenheim shortly thereafter unless there is someone else to take up their mantle. Surviving faction agents may seek immediate retribution, but the death of a faction leader seals their defeat in Drakkenheim for the foreseeable future.

Under the right circumstances, a player character who demonstrates unwavering belief in the faction and great leadership could rise through the ranks and replace a faction leader.

Faction Lieutenant

The faction lieutenant is the right-hand of the faction leader. As such, the lieutenant is usually the first point of contact the player characters have with a faction, and most can be encountered in Emberwood Village. Once the lieutenant is confident the players are capable and trustworthy collaborators, they'll facilitate an introduction with the faction leader.

Many lieutenants also lead elite faction strike teams. If the lieutenant is slain, the faction leader will appoint another faction member as a replacement.

Supporting Characters

Each faction has numerous rank-and-file members, support staff, craftspeople, recruits, and other followers. Use these lists to generate quick NPCs who might be guarding a stronghold, relaying a message, maintaining the supply lines, or fighting alongside (or against!) the player characters. You can add additional NPCs to the factions if you wish, but be careful when adding high-level NPCs or spellcasters capable of casting spells above 3rd level. The factions have specific and limited access to high-level magic. Powerful NPCs are meant to be rare so the player characters may rise to a position of importance and prominence during the campaign.

Strongholds

Most factions have several holdings in Drakkenheim, but one major location is the faction stronghold. Full details on each faction stronghold are described in chapter 8. This is where most faction members reside and where many faction resources are kept. If a faction loses its stronghold, the rank-and-file members are routed and the power of the faction is broken. If the faction leader survives, they may still be able to muster together a few remaining diehard agents to cause a few more complications for the player characters, but the faction teeters on the brink of defeat.

“As useful as magicians and wizards can be when organized, you should always have a bag of tricks... for sale of course.”

— Pluto Jackson

Missions

The faction leader or faction lieutenant may present these missions to the player characters, which further the faction's objectives. The missions are presented in a rough progression: those presented first may lead to later ones. Characters who complete these missions gain greater respect and trust from the faction, and are rewarded with faction boons (described below). In addition, when the player characters complete a faction mission they recieve experience points based on the advancement method you are using (as described in Character Advancement in chapter 2).

Many missions are directly tied to the City Locations described in chapters 6 and 7. In such cases, further details for running that mission are found in the “Adventure Hooks” section of the location entry. Other missions are open-ended adventure seeds to spur interactions with other factions. Nevertheless, you should feel free to invent additional missions for the factions based on the player characters' choices. Especially when the factions clash against each other, the player characters themselves collaborate with their faction allies to devise their own missions and specific goals.

Roleplaying Characteristics

Much like a player character, every faction has Personality Traits, Ideals, Bonds, and Flaws. Rather than qualities of any individual person, these describe ideological beliefs shared by all faction members. Use these characteristics to guide roleplaying interactions with faction agents, determine the way the faction behaves, and judge how their leaders might react to changing circumstances or unexpected events.

Faction NPCs often possess these characteristics, but may have their own personal interpretations. However, a faction that betrays its ideals or bonds has betrayed its own members. When a faction repeatedly fails to uphold its own ideals and bonds, its agents might start deserting Drakkenheim or refuse to comply when called to action.

Boons

Every faction possesses valuable resources and knowledge they use to advance their agenda, including equipment, information, magic items, mounts, spellcasting services, and more. These are represented by faction boons, which may be awarded to the player characters for completing faction missions, but also offered to player characters before a mission to help them complete it.

These boons are presented in a roughly escalating order: latter boons should only be offered later in the campaign to characters who have demonstrated their commitment to the faction. Unless otherwise indicated, a faction can only offer each boon once. Beyond this, how often you reward characters with a faction boon is up to you.

Other Resources

The factions' exact assets and wealth are intentionally abstract so you may exercise your judgement and decide what's appropriate given the circumstances. Regardless, the factions do not have infinite resources. Every faction is stretched thin, and must cope with severe limits and constraints on their finances, personnel, materials, equipment, and time. The nearest large city is several weeks' travel away and the surrounding villages have been abandoned. More troops require exponentially more supplies since there are so few uncontaminated food and water sources. For many of the factions, simply maintaining the ground they currently hold requires everything they've got. This is why the factions need the player characters to help them.

The characters may occasionally demand more from the factions, citing dire need or urgent circumstances. If the characters push hard for more resources and appeal to the factions' ideals, objectives, and bonds, you might grant them an additional boon for that mission. However, the next time the characters need help from the faction or would receive a boon, the faction can't offer them anything as they are recuperating their stockpile!

Strike Teams

While the factions seek assistance from the player characters, they aren't without their own agents. When they must dispatch their own warriors directly into the ruins, they send a Strike Team.

An allied faction might send strike teams as reinforcements to help the player characters on a critical mission. Consequently, an enemy faction can dispatch a strike team against the player characters to disrupt missions, capture them, or even assassinate them. Each faction keeps tabs on the player characters, and might even send a strike team to interfere during a mission that wouldn't otherwise involve them just to sabotage the characters' efforts. More ruthless factions might take the fight directly to the characters' doorsteps, hitting them while they are retreating, recuperating, or simply unprepared for battle. Especially devious GMs may opt to have faction strike teams operate behind-the-scenes by carrying out attacks while the player characters are occupied elsewhere!

Mustering Forces. Any faction can call up a strike team within a few hour's notice. However, mustering up larger forces for major offensives takes time. When a faction needs to assemble multiple teams at once to perform a specific task, it takes at least one day per strike team involved. This can give characters the chance to notice something big is being planned.

Reinforcements. The factions regularly bring in reinforcements and new recruits. However, increasing casualties amongst the rank-and-file devastate morale within all the factions, and it's a problem when its more elite strike teams are captured, defeated, or killed. When a faction strike team is destroyed, it takes roughly five days for the faction to assemble a replacement team. Under desperate circumstances, a faction can put together another group immediately. Should this group also be taken out, it takes ten days to draw up further replacements thereafter.

Retribution. Faction leaders often investigate when their agents go missing. Each faction possesses a web of informants, scouts, and spies, and can possibly use magical means to find out what happened. Unless an active effort is made to conceal what occurred, most factions can discover the fate of their agents within seven days and possibly even determine who was responsible. Skirmishes between adventurers and low-level faction agents are relatively common in the ruins, so such events may not incite immediate retribution, but rather careful observation. If the situation continues to escalate, the faction responds.

Major Offensives. Every faction knows that sending large numbers of soldiers into Drakkenheim is a foolish risk: several attempts have been made by much larger forces and failed. The biggest issue is contamination: there simply aren't enough spellcasters and materials to remove it quickly enough. Generally speaking, the factions will only consider launching major offensives if it means taking the cathedral, Castle Drakken, or another faction stronghold.

Schemes

Should your player characters become enemies with one of the factions, the factions enact these dastardly plots against them. These schemes are presented in escalating hostility; latter schemes are only used in dire conflict. Set one of these schemes into motion the next time the player characters venture into the ruins. If the players manage to foil the faction's schemes, the defeated faction will need at least a week before they can muster up another. On the other hand, the factions don't do things “just to get revenge”. They instead consider their long-term goals first. They retreat, regroup, and find a way to attack from a position of strength.

You can invent your own schemes. Try using a strike team in a creative or unexpected way, or consider the personal capabilities of each faction leader, especially the spells, magic items, and unique knowledge at their disposal. Don't be afraid to turn the player characters' own motivations, goals, and flaws against them!



Faction Reputation

Champions. The player characters have demonstrated themselves to be staunch supporters of the faction's cause. They've successfully completed multiple missions for the faction that prove their loyalty, including a mission where they acted directly against another faction. The faction offers the characters complete access to their resources, support, and information. The characters receive faction boons to help them complete missions.

Allies. The party and the faction are working together to advance their mutual goals, but they have some minor differences and disagreements. Characters might be working with multiple factions in this manner. The characters have helped the faction in several ways by completing a few missions, and proven themselves reliable and capable. The faction rewards characters with boons after they complete these missions.

Indifferent. They are neutral. Perhaps they aren't known to each other yet. The faction is willing to hire the party on a freelance basis to help fulfil their objectives — especially ones that require arm's-length interaction (such as working against another faction), but the faction doesn't trust the players yet. They may have had some rough interactions with low-level faction members, so the faction won't offer the players resources, support, or information beyond what is required to fulfil any missions they hire them to do. The faction might offer to trade for services and pay the characters in gold rather than grant them boons.

Adversaries. There isn't any trust here. The players show disregard for the faction's objectives. Minor skirmishes may have broken out with low-level faction members. The faction won't let the players use their resources or help. If the players want to repair the relationship, the faction offers the players a chance to complete a mission to demonstrate their commitment, possibly by striking directly at a rival faction. The faction occasionally sends strike teams to impede the party, disrupt their goals, and dissuade them from entering the city. However, these teams don't try to kill the characters. If violence breaks out, these strike teams either knock the characters out to try to capture them, deescalate, or flee.

Enemies. The characters have betrayed the faction's trust, murdered its members, and are working against the faction's most important goals in a profound way. The faction actively tries to thwart the characters using its schemes, and sends its deadly strike teams against the the characters.

The Amethyst Academy.name: The Amethyst Academy
The Amethyst Academy.text:
The Amethyst Academy

“Suffice to say, the Amethyst Academy has developed the means to harness the incredible arcane energies contained within delerium. We shall use it to create unfathomable magical wonders on a scale hitherto undreamt of, for the betterment and protection of all people. Only the Amethyst Academy has the knowledge to accomplish such a feat, and the wisdom to temper the wild and destructive potential of this volatile resource.”

- Archwizard Eldrick Runeweaver

The Amethyst Academy is a research institute, educational organization, and mage guild pursuing the arcane mysteries of delerium. The faction is small and outwardly aloof, yet subtly influential and tremendously wealthy. They are led by a shadowy directorate of powerful archmages who dispatched Archwizard @UUID[Actor.IFRQ1jK41KOQNjGl] to oversee their operations in Drakkenheim. Most of its members are potent arcane spellcasters with access to rare magical resources, but only a handful of agents are active in Drakkenheim.

Background

The Amethyst Academy began as a secret school for young sorcerers during a time when arcane magic faced extreme persecution from the clergy of the Sacred Flame. The mages located children who manifested magical talents, rescued them from their fearful and paranoid communities, and educated them in hidden strongholds and far-away castles so they might wield their abilities with trained and refined control. The secret school gradually grew into a secret society in its own right.

Sequestered in unseen universities to hide from the mage-slaying Knights of the Silver Order, the mages pooled their knowledge. They conducted research into arcane and cosmological phenomena, and developed the modern practice of wizardry. Over time, the Amethyst Academy secured allies amongst the nobility by providing them clandestine magical services and occult counsel, crafting enchanted heirlooms, protecting their castles with arcane wards, and teaching their heirs magic.

When these schemes were discovered by the Faith of the Sacred Flame, a renewed series of brutal inquisitions and vengeful witch-hunts began. What had been a shadow conflict between paladins and sorcerers for centuries spilled into outright war between noble houses who championed the Faith, and those that supported the Amethyst Academy. These conflicts ended with the Edicts of Lumen (detailed in Appendix E). Enacted three hundred years ago, this landmark treaty stopped the murderous suppression of arcane magic by the religious ministry, and established a new balance of power between mages, the Faith, and the nobility throughout the continent.

The Edicts of Lumen bestow extensive protections, full autonomy, and economic advantages to the Amethyst Academy, but also require the Academy to observe strict standards of mercantile neutrality and political non-intervention. Most importantly, it grants the Amethyst Academy guardianship of any child who demonstrates magical aptitude until they come of age and master their abilities. In exchange, the agreement stipulates that all arcane spellcasters are disinherited from any land, rank, or titles, including the scions of noble and royal families. Since the Edicts, Academy mages may work magic without fear of oppression from church or state, though the organization remains withdrawn as it increasingly turns its attention to global affairs and extraplanar happenings. However, the direction and focus of the Amethyst Academy has dramatically shifted following the destruction of Drakkenheim, when their greatest stronghold was cut off from them.

While the Amethyst Academy outwardly upholds the Edicts of Lumen, in recent years some have claimed the mages furtively flaunt its restrictions and disregard the terms that forbid dark magical practices. Others suspect the mages are weaving an arcane conspiracy to control commerce and influence politics while shielding themselves from the wrath of the Faithful.

Attire

Agents typically wear purple robes, cloaks, or hoods.

Academy Rings

Members of the Amethyst Academy each wear a set of rings made from exotic arcane metals. The number of rings worn corresponds to the highest level spell they can cast. Known as academy rings, these are magic items that identify them as an Academy graduate, and often permit access to Academy strongholds. A set of five or more functions as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9cIlRtKDtDXQtElf], and some allow control over a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.z85EsGS2GVWj46qE]. However, each set is made for a specific individual, and only that person may attune to that set of academy rings.

Roleplaying Characteristics

Symbol. A lidless arcane eye set within an octagram. Their colours are gold and purple.

Personality Traits

  • We act businesslike and professional when dealing with the wider world.
  • We put arcane theory into magical practice. Innovation, creativity, and invention must have purpose.
  • We do not trust outsiders, and don't volunteer information that is not requested or required. Non-magical folk rarely grasp arcane matters anyways.

Ideals

  • We rigorously study and carefully teach arcane magic. We value eldritch knowledge, through which we may harness the power of the cosmos itself.
  • Mages can accomplish incredible wonders by working together effectively. We are protected and strengthened by our disciplined hierarchy.
  • There is no such thing as evil magic, but some mages misuse magic for evil purposes. Unfortunately, those who do not practice the arcane arts rarely grasp such nuance.

Bonds

  • The Amethyst Academy safeguards occult secrets that would be abused and feared by the wider world. What others view as dangerous, we seek to understand.
  • We cannot allow the brutal suppression of arcane magic to ever occur again, so we respect the Edicts of Lumen. We must maintain the trust of the nobility and avoid arousing suspicion and hostility from the Faith of the Sacred Flame.
  • We use wealth accumulated by selling magical services to educate young mages and support further arcane research. Our students are our future, and they must be kept safe.

Flaws

  • Since we are so often misunderstood, we act in unseen and secret ways.
  • We are researchers and scholars, not warriors. Risking our talented members is wasteful and reckless when their minds can be put to much better use. Other lives are disposable.
  • We believe only Academy mages possess the intelligence and wisdom to wield arcane magic in a responsible way. Magic users who aren't Academy members are undisciplined amateurs at best, and more often become unhinged villains.

Strongholds

The Amethyst Academy does not currently have a dedicated base of operations in Drakkenheim. Indeed, one of their most important objectives is reclaiming the Inscrutable Tower, so it can be used for such purposes!

Emberwood Accommodations. For the time being, most Academy members simply make use of local accommodations: Eldrick and @UUID[Actor.1p6ksQrMvxCBPkga] have booked a permanent suite in the Red Lion Hotel. However, the Amethyst Academy has secretly created a permanent @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8aWtP5hcrmcEesBW] in the cellar beneath the abandoned Eventide Manor in Emberwood Village. Academy agents come and go from the cellar using @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1N8dDMMgZ1h1YJ3B]spells.

Distant Fortresses. Far away from Drakkenheim, the Amethyst Academy has many great fortresses, libraries, and universities. Most notable are the Enigma Ziggurat in the Free City of Liberio, and Paradox Castle in the distant Eastern Vale. Both have well-guarded @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8aWtP5hcrmcEesBW]{Teleportation Circles}, and Academy agents working in Drakkenheim usually teleport back and forth between these strongholds and the secret circle in Emberwood Village. The sigil sequences of these teleportation circles is a closely guarded secret known only to Academy mages who can cast 5th level spells.

“The Academy proves to be mysterious and secretive at every turn, but I know not to ask too many questions if I want to bring home the bacon. I'd be a fool to bite the hand that feedssme.”

— Veo Sjena

Objectives

Collect and Study Delerium

Far away from Drakkenheim in secret laboratories, Amethyst Academy wizards relentlessly research delerium samples recovered from the ruins. Their brilliant minds have crafted potent arcane artefacts and invented mighty new spells powered by the vast energies contained within the crystals. Though the true origin of delerium remains unknown to them, many Academy assets are now dedicated to the study and refinement of delerium. They procure enormous quantities to fuel their esoteric experiments and eldritch industries. Rather than risk their own members' lives in the ruins of Drakkenheim, the Academy usually obtains delerium through various grey market sources, typically by hiring adventurers.

The mages do not disregard the dangers presented by delerium's contaminating properties. In fact, it is precisely because of these hazards that the mages believe only they can use the crystals responsibly. Thus, the Academy seeks complete control over this critical resource both to protect the wider world and to secure their magical hegemony for the foreseeable future. However, other factions are now moving to reclaim Drakkenheim and potentially install a new ruling dynasty. Such political upheavals could affect the Academy's ability to research and harvest delerium.The Academy does not want a ruler who will destroy delerium, force the Academy to pay exorbitant sums to obtain it, or impose conditions on how the Academy may use the crystals.

Ultimately, the Academy has zero interest in seeing Drakkenheim restored and rebuilt, and view this as a folly doomed to fail. Rather, they have an ambitious plan to transform the city ruins into a quarry for their research and industry. Once they fulfil their other goals, the Amethyst Academy wants the other factions to totally abandon Drakkenheim so they can have sole control over the ruins.

Reclaim the Inscrutable Tower

Drakkenheim was home to one of the Amethyst Academy's most important strongholds: the Inscrutable Tower. This immense structure houses vast repositories of magical lore, incomplete magical experiments, hidden vaults containing unspeakable extraplanar entities, and powerful magic items sheltered from the world at large — all rendered completely inaccessible to the Academy since the meteor fell. The Deep Haze has settled within the tower, scrambling the Academy's own arcane wards and foiling every attempt to enter or observe the Tower using teleportation or divination magic.

The mages have already expended considerable effort attempting to retake the Tower on their own. These attempts catastrophically failed. The pragmatic wizards cannot afford to exhaust the Academy's resources in such a fruitless manner any longer, so now they turn to research and patient methods to advance their goals in Drakkenheim. They seek a suitably talented, trustworthy, and expendable adventuring party to conduct survey and recovery missions into the Inscrutable Tower. If the Tower were to be secured and repaired, the Amethyst Academy would have the ideal staging ground to begin the mass industrial exploitation of delerium, and would be able to bring its full resources to bear in Drakkenheim.

Obtain the Inscrutable Staff

Many talented mages were lost or killed by the meteor strike — including the former Archmage of Drakkenheim, Adriana Modiera. Her position on the Archmage's Directorate has remained vacant ever since. The Academy desperately wishes to discover her ultimate fate, recover her research, and obtain the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.InsT000000000017], the symbol of office for the Archmage of Drakkenheim, which is also one of the Seals of Drakkenheim. Traditionally, the Archmage of Drakkenheim acts as an advisor on the royal council, so possessing this @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.InsT000000000017] ensures the Amethyst Academy maintains their influence in the political destiny of Westemär.

Key Figures

Archwizard @UUID[Actor.IFRQ1jK41KOQNjGl] heads up the Amethyst

Academy operations in Drakkenheim and serves as the faction leader. The tiefling mage @UUID[Actor.1p6ksQrMvxCBPkga] works alongside him as lieutenant.

@UUID[Actor.IFRQ1jK41KOQNjGl] serves as the acting Archmage of Drakkenheim within the Academy Directorate, but this is a provisional position. He will not be confirmed to a lifetime appointment until he successfully secures the Inscrutable Tower. He is accountable to the Academy Directorate, but only reveals his true position to close collaborators. Although he does not lead the Amethyst Academy as a whole, his death or defeat would cause the Directorate to seriously reevaluate their position in Drakkenheim.

Eldrick Runeweaver

One of the finest professors in the Amethyst Academy, @UUID[Actor.IFRQ1jK41KOQNjGl] has personally instructed a generation of talented arcane spellcasters. He is the foremost living expert on abjuration magic, but is also highly regarded within the Academy as a dedicated administrator and calculating leader. If Eldrick Runeweaver successfully retakes the Inscrutable Tower, he will likely take up the vacant spot in the Academy Directorate and assume the mantle of Archmage of Drakkenheim.

Eldrick Runeweaver is a towering and broad-shouldered man in his mid-sixties. His amber eyes glow softly behind his circular glasses, and he has a square-cut, greying black beard. He wears nine rings of silver, gold, and electrum: one on each finger except his left thumb. He wears flowing purple garb with golden embroidery, and carries an obsidian staff tipped with a delerium crystal.

  • Personality Trait. I carefully calculate my every action, and I speak using a few well-chosen words. I'm a teacher at heart, so I often phrase my responses in the form of a pointed question.
  • Ideal. I will seek out more information whenever I encounter an unknown situation or problem. Through reason and logic, the facts always bear out the truth of the matter.
  • Bond. I hold a position of responsibility and authority within the Amethyst Academy, and it is my duty to protect the Academy's interests, carry out its agenda, and keep its many secrets.
  • Flaw. I care deeply for my students, but tend to overlook their faults and failures. I've had several wayward apprentices over the years, and I've often had to cover up their mistakes.

Eldrick Runeweaver has a cat familiar, and travels with an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.h98AuPfomEPcCibP] bodyguard and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.ZQTCZfTV9ZoTjNCU] servant. He most often communicates via @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.GtGjNjPBgUHxGYAD], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.uAwtVZkiSTyP6ORB], and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ePhRKHXRE7l1sEoQ] spells, or by sending his @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.jccbeBIfLrqEZnDP] instead. Eldrick always has a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4smlOvpF5AQHcyg1] spell in place, and has a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.h830iyqParFleNqR] kept in a distant stronghold with extra equipment should the unthinkable occur.

Eldrick's Simulacrum. This special simulacrum uses the game statistics for an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.B7lBOr1AahNZs4a6].

Eldrick's Spellbooks. Eldrick keeps many spellbooks in secret places, which contain every spell on the Wizard spell list except @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] (knowledge of this spell is restricted to the Academy Directorate).

River

@UUID[Actor.1p6ksQrMvxCBPkga] is a tiefling mage. She is a short woman in her late twenties. Her attire is practical and professional: a hip-length purple jacket with a high collar, and belted at her waist are several pouches and pockets. She wears five rings on her right hand. Two oddly-shaped dark brown horns sprout backwards from her flowing blue hair, creating the impression of two boats at sea. River has spotted brown skin and impish features: her teeth are too sharp, her tongue too long, and it's slightly unsettling when she smiles.

  • Personality Trait. I converse using precise academic terminology, but amongst those I trust as competent and capable, I inject a wry and sardonic sense of humor.
  • Ideal. I like people who are professional, deliver results, and don't ask questions. I cannot stand fools who waste my time with buffoonery, haggling, and excuses.
  • Bond. Eldrick Runeweaver is my mentor, teacher, and friend. I've worked alongside him for years, and any success he has will be mine as well.
  • Flaw. I grew up surrounded by the magical amenities of the Amethyst Academy, so I don't understand what life is like for those who had a more mundane upbringing.

River always has @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.GtGjNjPBgUHxGYAD] and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8aWtP5hcrmcEesBW] spells prepared, and is accompanied by her @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.dLQiESMsfsXijD5c] familiar and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.z85EsGS2GVWj46qE] bodyguard. She wears a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9cIlRtKDtDXQtElf] that also acts as her shield guardian control amulet. Only River can attune to this ring. She also carries 2d6 uncommon spell scrolls or potions.

Academy Mages

A handful of other @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.mQnsXanewsPiV7QE] lead survey teams in the ruins. Here are several NPCs to fill out the various Academy agents the player characters may encounter in Drakkenheim:

  • Rufus Stonewall - A grumpy old professor who is looking forward to retiring.
  • Nimble Quill - An eager new graduate hoping toprove themselves.
  • Cogsworth B. Copperpot - An addled old diviner confused about his own predictions.
  • Murdok the Caller - A know-it-all conjurer with a knack for having the perfect spell prepared.
  • Corvus Greysky - A grim necromancer with a morbid senseof humor.
  • Elvira Evermore - A stern abjurer who takes magic usevery seriously.
  • Luna Mumph - A young gnome illusionist who seems lost in her own world.
  • Harmon Munk - An elf transmuter who is always misplacing his alchemical reagents.
  • Neptune Lee - A charismatic enchanter who likes to boast about his accomplishments.
  • August “Gus” Elderfire - An experienced evoker who never does things by the book.

Missions

Crystal Sample. Recover a delerium crystal from the Rat's Nest Tavern. (See chapter 6)

Exclusive Contract. Secure the cooperation of the Ironhelm dwarves prospecting in the Scar. (See chapter 6)

Stolen Homework. Steal the research and findings of malfeasant wizard @UUID[Actor.jfJGagVOoUgyCyxn] from his lair in Reed Manor. (See chapter 6)

Recover an Eldritch Lily. If the Amethyst Academy learns about the formula for @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.AquT000000000001], they'll dispatch characters to gather samples from Queen's Park. (See chapter 7)

Broker an Alliance. The Amethyst Academy asks characters to broker a truce with either the @UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe], the Hooded Lanterns, or possibly, the Followers of the Falling Fire so they can secure their supply of delerium and access to the ruins.

Plight of the Pale Man. Slay the @UUID[Actor.uMQvgbPhxlHLl1vG] and acquire his spellbooks. (See chapter 7)

End the Iron Banshee. Seek out and destroy Ryan Greymere, the Iron Banshee. (See chapter 7)

Reclaim the Inscrutable Tower. The Amethyst Academy asks characters of 9th level or higher to participate in a raid mission to reclaim the Inscrutable Tower. (See chapter 8)

Expedition to the Crater. The Amethyst Academy commissions the characters to mount an expedition to the Crater Basin and see what's there. (See chapter 7)

The Sequestered City. Once the Amethyst Academy completes its goals of obtaining the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.InsT000000000017] and claiming the Tower, they ask the characters to help them subtly manipulate or sabotage the other factions into leaving Drakkenheim. (See chapter 10)

Boons

Arcane Supplies. The Amethyst Academy gives each character one uncommon potion or spell scroll (of a spell from the Wizard spell list) of their choice when they begin a mission that directly advances the Academy's goals. Higher-level characters with proven reputations may be offered items of rare or very rare quality instead.

Arcane Spellcasting Services. @UUID[Actor.1p6ksQrMvxCBPkga] and Eldrick Runeweaver can offer their services as spellcasters to the characters as needed (they won't personally travel to the ruins, however).

Material Components. The Amethyst Academy can provide material components for spells of 5th level or lower, whose sum total value is no more than 500 gold pieces, prior to any mission.

Occult Lore. The Amethyst Academy is the foremost authority on magical lore and arcane phenomena. Their sages can answer questions about contemporary magic, magical creatures such as constructs, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead, any spell or magic item in the Core Rules, and historical facts about the past five hundred years. If you feel the matter is something that might require some deeper research, it takes the Academy one week to unearth relevant information. The Academy uses its discretion when revealing details about sensitive topics — especially information about the meteor or delerium, and never reveals its own secrets or details about its internal politics to outsiders.

Elemental Summons. If the player characters have a reasonable need for reinforcements during a mission, the Amethyst Academy offers the characters an elemental gem.

Magical Artifice. As a reward for completing an Academy mission, the mages offer the party one uncommon magic item of their choice, subject to GM approval. The Amethyst Academy grants this boon once per player character. Once each character has received an uncommon item, the Academy will begin granting them one rare item each, then one very rare item each, as appropriate for completing missions of commensurate importance.

Guild Membership. A sorcerer, warlock, or wizard who can cast spells of 5th level or higher is offered guild membership in the Amethyst Academy. If they accept, they are given a purple robe of useful objects, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.1taRIMF9w7jpnonN], and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9cIlRtKDtDXQtElf]. These items bear Academy iconography, and clearly identify the character as an Academy member when worn.

Library Gift. Characters instrumental to retaking the Inscrutable Tower who demonstrate a complete commitment to the Academy's ideals and goals are rewarded with their choice of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.BjyTJn9oGvURWKJR], a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.2BYm8to5KldN8eYu], or a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.WnKWD1FuAFUE7f4v].

Stike Teams

Summoned Spies

The Amethyst Academy agents send summoned creatures and magical constructs into the ruins to gather information: either 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) mephits, 2 ([[/r 1d4]]) @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.dLQiESMsfsXijD5c]{Imps}, or a single @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.ZQTCZfTV9ZoTjNCU]. As magical communications are disrupted in the Haze, these creatures must survive and escape the city to report their findings, so they rarely engage in combat. These creatures often do not survive these missions, and some get lost and never return. Nevertheless, they're an essential tool for the Academy to have eyes and ears inside Drakkenheim.

Academy Survey Team

Though rare, a handful of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.mQnsXanewsPiV7QE]{Mages} lead survey teams into the ruins to carry out field research. They are typically encountered conducting experiments, observing magical phenomena, facilitating communications between other Academy agents, and providing magical support as needed. However, if the situation in Drakkenheim escalates, these agents help by casting spells, orchestrating traps, and summoning creatures.

A survey team is led by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.mQnsXanewsPiV7QE] with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.fkCNtbvPOMd7mipF]familiar and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.z85EsGS2GVWj46qE] bodyguard. The mage wears a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.9cIlRtKDtDXQtElf] that also acts as a shield guardian control amulet, but only the mage can attune to this ring. They also possess 1d6 uncommon spell scrolls or potions. They always have the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.GtGjNjPBgUHxGYAD] and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8aWtP5hcrmcEesBW] spells prepared.

Most travel with 1d4 research assistants: either hedge wizards or @UUID[Actor.lDDpTfJxg7ze0lIH]{Academy Apprentices}. An @UUID[Actor.lDDpTfJxg7ze0lIH] uses the game statistics of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq] with Intelligence 13 and the ability to cast two cantrips and one 1st level-spell from the Wizard spell list. (Spell Attack +3, Spell Save DC 11)

Bound Elementals

When the Amethyst Academy requires extra muscle, they conjure elemental creatures and press them into their service using @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.42O2aNBW7vK90gTL] spells.
